entry.summary: Introduction Filtering user input in Angular can be a bit tricky, especially when you want to enforce a specific format through user input validations. In this article, we'll explore how to filter user input in an HTML text input while utilizing Angular's reactive forms or template-driven forms. Let's address a common scenario where you want to ensure a specific format for a tracking number, for instance, ensuring it matches the pattern AB123456789CD. Why Input Filtering Is Necessary User input filtering is important for several reasons, including preventing invalid data submission, improving data integrity, and enhancing user experience. In scenarios like tracking numbers, ensuring the format is kept clean can prevent errors when processing such inputs. Filtering User Input with Native Jaâ€¦

entry.title: Exploring the Rate package and the Token Bucket algorithm
entry.summary:
At my Circuit Breaker post, I mentioned that nowadays it is common that the application has to communicate with other ones, and with that, traffic control strategies become essential. Recently I've discovered the Token Bucket, a strategy based on tokens used to control the traffic. Imagine that you have 5 tickets to a ride, and every new hour you get a new ticket, but you can never exceed the limit of 5. Every time you ride, a ticket is used. So, if you use all your tickets, you can't ride anymore until you get a new one. It is a very interesting algorithm, used by the PIX (a Brazilian instant payment method), for not allowing an attacker to scrape all users' data.
Translating to code, let's propose a scenario where 10 goroutines are initialized and execute something. If you don't know yeâ€¦

entry.title: How to Resolve SDL3 Renderer Issues in C Programming?
entry.summary: Creating a window and renderer with SDL3 can be a bit tricky, especially if you are migrating from SDL2. This article addresses the common issues that arise during this process and provides clear solutions to ensure your SDL application runs smoothly. Understanding the Migration from SDL2 to SDL3 When transitioning from SDL2 to SDL3, it's crucial to understand the differences between the two versions, especially regarding function definitions and parameters. One of the main changes in SDL3 is that SDL_CreateRenderer function now requires three parameters instead of two. This can lead to compilation errors if you attempt to use the same function call from SDL2 in SDL3. Common Issues When Compiling SDL3 Code In your example, the first issue arises when you attempt to create a renderer with oâ€¦

entry.title: Understanding RBAC in ArgoCD: ConfigMap vs AppProject
entry.summary: Introduction to RBAC in ArgoCD Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) is a crucial security mechanism in many software systems, and ArgoCD is no exception. As you dive into the concept of RBAC in ArgoCD, you've noticed two primary ways to configure access rules: using ConfigMap or directly within the AppProject. This article aims to clarify the differences between these two methods, the best practices for implementing RBAC, and address the specific issues you've encountered. What is RBAC in ArgoCD? RBAC allows administrators to control user access to resources based on roles assigned to users or groups. In the context of ArgoCD, this means you can control which users (or service accounts) can perform actions on applications, projects, and clusters. Understanding how RBAC works in ArgoCD is essenâ€¦

This article explores how to harness AI to generate code effortlessly, transforming the way we approach coding and development tasks. AI tools are revolutionizing coding by automating routine tasks, allowing developers to focus on more complex challenges. Types of AI coding tools include assistants for code generation, debugging aids, and automated testing solutions. Integrating AI into your workflow can significantly boost productivity, making coding faster and more efficient. It's essential to maintain code quality when using AI tools, as they can generâ€¦

entry.title: End-to-End DevOps: Running a .NET App in Kubernetes with Docker, ACR, and AKS
entry.summary:
Introduction
We will be building a sample web application using dotnet core with any IDE but in my case, I will be using VS Code. The application will be tested in a local Kubernetes cluster before deploying this to Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS). You can also use any language of your choice as long as you can wrap it in a container image; we will be using C# for this project. VS Code Docker Azure CLI Azure Account .Net SDK Clone a sample of this repository for this project by running the command:
git clone https://github.com/hpranav/kodekloud.git Change to the repository directory
cd kodekloud/AKS/KodeKloudApp
Before you test your app, make sure that .Net sdk is installed by checking first using the command dotnet --list-sdks
dotnet --version
Now that you have .Net sdk instaâ€¦

entry.title: Wisconsin Investment Board sold off its Bitcoin ETF stash
entry.summary: The State of Wisconsin Investment Board (SWIB), which oversees the stateâ€™s retirement funds, unloaded its shares in BlackRockâ€™s iShares Bitcoin Trust ETF (IBIT) during the first quarter, filings show. The Wisconsin Investment Board reported no spot Bitcoin ETF positions in its 13F filing to the US Securities and Exchange Commission on May 15, liquidating all 6,060,351 IBIT shares it reported holding from the previous quarter.Â The more than 6 million IBIT shares are worth around $355.6 million at current prices. SWIB was one of the first state investment funds to provide Bitcoin exposure to US retirees when it bought $164 million worth of Bitcoin ETFs in Q1 2024 â€” the same quarter the Bitcoin products launched. Source: Julian Fahrer The mass sell-off comes only a quarter after SWIB reporteâ€¦

entry.summary: Global foreign exchange and payments platforms are lobbying hard against stablecoins, which stand to significantly disrupt their business models, investor Kevin Oâ€™Leary said during a keynote address at Consensus 2025. Legacy forex and payments platforms often extract large fees for servicing cross-border cash transfers and stand to lose out on revenue if regulated stablecoins become accepted as a cheaper, faster alternative, Oâ€™Leary said at the Toronto conference.Â â€œCurrency trading is a multi-trillion dollar market â€” and itâ€™s old and ugly and inefficient,â€ Oâ€™Leary said, adding that â€œ[ t]he biggest threat to that monopoly or oligopoly is a regulated stablecoin.â€Â â€œOnce thatâ€™s approved, the multi-trillion dollar FX market becomes efficient, transparent, and inexpensive,â€ he said.Â Kevin Oâ€™â€¦

entry.title: Asset tokenization expected to speed capital flows, says Chainlink's Nazarov
entry.summary: Asset tokenization is set to accelerate the movement of capital across traditional markets, according to Chainlink co-founder Sergey Nazarov. Speaking with Cointelegraph at Consensus 2025 in Toronto, Nazarov said the shift will boost capital velocity in asset classes such as treasuries, equities, private credit, commercial debt, and real estate. "I think that there are two sides to this equation. One is the asset, and the other one is the payment. So, you need more high-quality assets onchain, but you also need more frictionless payments that existing institutions can use easily," Nazarov said on May 14. The remarks came on the same day Chainlink announced a partnership with Kinexys, a blockchain network for institutional-grade tokenized assets by JP Morgan, and digital asset firm Ondo Fiâ€¦

entry.title: Bitdeer Q1 revenue falls more than 40% year-over-year
entry.summary: Bitdeer Technologies Group reported a 41% year-over-year drop in revenue to $70.1 million for the first quarter of 2025, the Bitcoin miner said on May 15.Â The Singaporean company clocked an operating loss of $3.2 million for the quarter, down from a $34.1 million profit during the same period last year, its earnings release said.Â However, Bitdeer reported a Q1 net income of more than $400 million, largely driven by gains on convertible notes and warrants issued to stablecoin issuer Tether in 2024. Bitdeerâ€™s revenue declines come as miners increasingly expand beyond Bitcoin (BTC) mining and pivot toward supplying high-performance computing (HPC) for artificial intelligence applications.Â â€œAs we scale self-mining and execute on our ASIC [mining hardware] roadmap, we are also advancing planâ€¦

entry.title: FTX estate to start distributing more than $5B on May 30
entry.summary: More than two-and-a-half years after filing for bankruptcy, cryptocurrency exchange FTX is moving forward with repaying users who have not had access to their funds. In a May 15 notice, the FTX Recovery Trust announced that it would begin disbursing funds to the second group of parties eligible under the exchangeâ€™s reorganization plan. Starting on May 30, FTX will send more than $5 billion to creditors â€œwithin 1 to 3 business daysâ€ through crypto firms BitGo and Kraken.Â In accordance with the reorganization plan, FTX said five groups of â€œconvenience classesâ€ would receive between 54% and 120% distribution of assets. The repayment schedule for the next class of creditors will be â€œannounced in due course,â€ and the debtors were expected to pay up to $16 billion if all claims were filed. Breaâ€¦

entry.title: Stablecoin regulation 'next catalyst' for crypto industry â€” Aptos head
entry.summary: Stablecoin regulation is â€œthe next catalystâ€ for the crypto industry and could lead to unprecedented â€œappetite from institutional investors,â€ according to Ash Pampati, head of ecosystem at the Aptos Foundation. In an interview with Cointelegraph at Consensus 2025 in Toronto, Pampati said that â€œthe whole world outside of the United States [â€¦] has already jumped onto this [stablecoins],â€ adding that â€œthe US is [...] at the doorstep.â€ â€œI really think about new use cases that can emerge because of the borderless nature of stablecoins, because of the efficiency of the dollar onchain,â€ he said. â€œIf you're trying to send money to your friend in Nigeria, why do you have to go through a bunch of hoops?â€ Stablecoins are often used to transfer money across borders, as they are easier and cheaper to â€¦

entry.title: Canada lags with stablecoin approach, but thereâ€™s room to catch up
entry.summary: The slow adoption of stablecoins in Canada has some local crypto industry observers concerned that the country is falling behind. The Canadian Securities Administrators (CSA) classified stablecoins as â€œsecurities and/or derivativesâ€ in December 2022 after the FTX debacle that shook markets and turned many lawmakers against the crypto industry. Regulating stablecoins as a security has seen few local stablecoin issuers arise, but in the United States and the European Union, softening regulations have seen significant growth in the stablecoin market. This makes Canada, observers say, less competitive with other jurisdictions.Â Of particular concern is the perceived gap in peer-to-peer (P2P) payments in Canada, which stablecoins are uniquely qualified to fill.Â Stablecoins globally have grown â€¦

The same study also estimates that genAI may affect at least 10% of tasks performed by approximately 85% of the human workforce. The TL;DR from these stats? AIâ€™s effects are likely to be both broad and deep. If AI doesnâ€™t already scare you, self-learning AI agents that autonomously achieve goals may fix that. Forget your sanitized ChatGPT conversations and bland AI assistants. Superior agents are AI that autonomously achieve human-set objectives by any means necessary. entry.title: What the 10-year Treasury yield means for crypto yields and stablecoins
entry.summary:
Understanding the 10-year Treasury yield: Definition and importance
The 10-year Treasury yield is the interest rate that the US government pays to borrow money for 10 years. When the government needs cash, it issues bonds called Treasury notes, and the 10-year note is one of the most watched. The â€œyieldâ€ is the annual return youâ€™d get if you bought that bond and held it until it matures. Itâ€™s expressed as a percentage, like 4% or 5%. Think of it as the government saying, â€œHey, lend me $1,000, and Iâ€™ll pay you back in 10 years with some interest.â€ That interest rate and the yield move up or down based on demand for the bonds, inflation expectations and the overall economy. Because US Treasurys are considered safe (the government isnâ€™t likely to defâ€¦

entry.title: Tether blacklist delay allowed $78M in illicit USDT transfers: Report
entry.summary: Update (May 15 at 3:10 pm UTC): This article has been updated to include comments from Tether. A lag in Tetherâ€™s wallet blacklisting process allowed over $78 million in illicit funds to be moved before enforcement actions took effect, according to a new report from blockchain compliance company AMLBot. Tetherâ€™s address blacklisting becomes effective only after a considerable delay from when the process is initiated on Ethereum and Tron, according the report published May 15. â€œThis delay originates from Tetherâ€™s multisignature contract setup on both Tron and Ethereum, transforming what should be an immediate compliance action into a window of opportunity for illicit actors,â€œ the report reads. Tetherâ€™s blacklisting procedure is a multi-step process with a first transaction effectively warâ€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin mining 2025: Post-halving profitability, hashrate and energy trends
entry.summary: After the 2024 halving, Bitcoin mining entered its fifth epoch and block rewards were reduced from 6.25 BTC to 3.125 BTC. This forced miners to rethink their operations, optimize efficiency, cut energy costs and upgrade hardware to remain profitable. Cointelegraph Research, with insights from industry experts at Uminers, examines this transformation in its latest report. The analysis covers ASIC efficiency improvements, corporate performance, geographical expansion and new revenue models. As miners adapt, Bitcoin moves into a new era where institutional momentum and sovereign adoption could redefine its role in the global financial system. Download the full report to uncover how miners are navigating this shift and what the future holds for Bitcoinâ€™s mining industry. The mining industryâ€™s â€¦

On May 15, blockchain data showed that Tetherâ€™s treasury minted $1 billion of its dollar-pegged stablecoin, USDt (USDT), into the Tron network.Â As of May 14, Tetherâ€™s stablecoin transparency page shows that Tronâ€™s authorized USDT totals $73.7 billion, while Ethereum has $74.5 billion in authorized USDT tokens. If the newly minted tokens are added to the number of authorized USDT assets, Tronâ€™s supply surpasses Ethereumâ€™s.Â In terms of circulating supply, Tron also has the lead with $73.6 billion USDT on the network, while Ethereum only has $71.8 billion.Â Source: PeckShieldAlert Tetherâ€™s USDT mints replenish the companyâ€™s token inventory Tether CEO Paoâ€¦
